text: The eager tags are used only in a partial evaluation mode called Eager Execution. For normal modes you should use the non-eager tags. cc <@UCJANAW1Y>
Is there any hubl function to get the difference between two dates?
Ah ha thanks i must have looked at that page 100 times today and not spotted that and is there something to get today's date <@U7SL518D6>
thanks again must be going HubSpot documentation snow blind

haha, it’s alright.

I don’t know what your use-case is but when possible I’d suggest using JS to do the date comparison rather than checking against the today function.

If you use the today function we can’t prerender and serve the same content to everyone for each separate page load. So using JavaScript instead may have a performance benefit.
Is the a way to sort tags/ categories in a dropdown for blogs in alphabetical order?

Hi Melissa this would be so much easier if we had a preview page but I will take a stab at it. Not sure why  background css is being used in .image-block it looks like you are using "img src". I think that is why your background-size: cover; isn't working as expected. For img src I would use "object-fit: cover;".
